** checking errors generated by recursive calls EASY**

declare module mod1;
declare module mod2;

<<module mod1>>
takes input [K: array[1..20] of integer, B: boolean];
start
   declare f:boolean;
   declare a: array [1..20] of integer;
   declare b:integer;
   use module mod2 with parameters b;        ** No Error **
   use module mod1 with parameters a,f;      ** Error :- Recursive call **
   use module mod1 with parameters a;      ** Error :- Recursive call **
end

<<module mod2>>
takes input [x:integer];
start

end

<<<driver program>>>
start
   declare list1: array[1..20] of integer;
   declare b:boolean;
   use module mod1 with parameters list1,b;  ** No error **
end
